Dinner.synopsis: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.
Dinner.how_to_trigger: - Go to camp to Trigger first camp night- come back to level- use code: oe qnight NIGHT_MonitorIntro_a9297517-ab4d-482d-b287-fc6e7001d93e- move a distance and have supplies to trigger second camp night- Don't have Laezel in party or will trigger different cinematic- After talking with monitor in camp he will teleport you to Dinner hall for this cinematic to start

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The provided data contains two sessions: 'Dinner' and 'AD_Vanish'. The 'Dinner' session clearly has trigger steps indicating that it occurs after the first camp night and upon reaching a certain level, but these instructions are internal to this session and do not link it to any other session in the data. The 'AD_Vanish' session, however, has no synopsis or trigger information, making it impossible to establish any ordering or mutual exclusiveness with 'Dinner' or any other session. Therefore, based on the information provided, there are no ordering or exclusiveness constraints between these sessions.

Dinner_72.speaker: Karlach
Dinner_72.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner_72.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner_3.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_3.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner_86.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_86.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

Dinner_29.speaker: Player
Dinner_29.text: We're in the Hells, aren't we. Take me back. Now.

Dinner_58.speaker: Player
Dinner_58.text: I will rise as a kith'rak. Your threats do not worry me.

Dinner_40.speaker: Player
Dinner_40.text: I'm getting tired of your games.

Dinner_22.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_22.text: Are you not entertained? Well - far be it from me to disappoint.

Dinner_73.speaker: Player
Dinner_73.text: Ignore him and fill your plate.

Dinner_10.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_10.text: Not easily rattled, I see. Good. Makes the next part that much more straightforward.

Dinner_8.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_8.text: What's better than a devil you don't know?

Dinner_41.speaker: Karlach
Dinner_41.context: NodeContext: Surprise, even fear in her voice. This is early in the game so she's still fresh from the hells. Referring to Raphael's first revelation of who he is.

Dinner_35.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_35.text: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.

Dinner_33.speaker: Player
Dinner_33.text: I never seek help from devils.

Dinner_19.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_19.text: You do not seek it, but it has found you:

Dinner_63.speaker: Player
Dinner_63.text: Eloquent words, but I'm not seeking another pact.

Dinner_37.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_37.text: Easy, easy. I'm here to help, not harm.
Dinner_37.context: NodeContext: Easy, easy: take your time - he's not intimidated, almost like he's talking to an excited child

Dinner_89.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_89.text: One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.

Dinner_47.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_47.text: I could fix it all like that.
Dinner_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.

Dinner_42.speaker: Player
Dinner_42.text: I'll do anything to get rid of the tadpole.

Dinner_23.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_23.text: Oh. That's disappointing. I prefer it when my clients put up a fight...

Dinner_0.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_0.text: ...only to realise victory was never an option.

Dinner_77.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_77.text: Try to cure yourself. Shop around - beg, borrow, and steal. Exhaust every possibility until none are left.

Dinner_93.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_93.text: And when hope has been whittled down to the very marrow of despair - that's when you'll come knocking on my door.

Dinner_75.speaker: Karlach
Dinner_75.text: That's what separates us from the devils, soldier. They think our greatest strength is a weakness.
Dinner_75.context: NodeContext: Disgust with Raphael, but proud of being a hopeful mortal.

Dinner_90.speaker: Player
Dinner_90.text: And if I do want to take this deal - how would I find you?

Dinner_55.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_55.text: I'll be around. Watching you squirm like a tadpole through a nice juicy brain.

Dinner_24.speaker: Player
Dinner_24.text: I'll have the last laugh in the end.

Dinner_94.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_94.text: I've always wondered what a laughing mind flayer sounds like.

Dinner_67.speaker: Player
Dinner_67.text: Take me back. After that, I never want to see you again.

Dinner_96.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_96.text: By all means bite the hand that feeds you while you still have teeth.

Dinner_32.speaker: Player
Dinner_32.text: I'll rip out your mocking tongue.

Dinner_44.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_44.text: Ah, yes. The tongue. Yet another piece of pleasurable anatomy you'll soon have to do without.

Dinner_82.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_82.text: All those pretty little symptoms - sundering skin, dissolving guts - they haven't manifested yet, have they?

Dinner_74.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_74.text: One might say you're a paragon of luck.

Dinner_53.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_53.text: I'll be there when it runs out.

Dinner_15.speaker: Player
Dinner_15.text: I need to think this over.

Dinner_54.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_54.text: Take all the time you need - but make up your mind before you're counting down with tentacles.

Dinner_62.speaker: Player
Dinner_62.text: You're mad if you think I'll make a deal with a devil.

Dinner_49.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_49.text: And what is madness but a denial of reality?

Dinner_51.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_51.text: Still, I've a feeling you'll change your mind. Before it's changed for you...

Dinner_79.speaker: Player
Dinner_79.text: Then fix it - or die at my hand.

Dinner_81.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_81.text: Yes... I like it when my clients put up a fight...

Dinner_97.speaker: Player
Dinner_97.text: I serve an oath, not a devil. My honour is not for sale.

Dinner_45.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_45.text: Your oath is in tatters, paladin. You abandoned your honour as soon as it became inconvenient.

Dinner_34.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_34.text: But the darkness won't save you anymore than the light could. You'll realise that in time.

Dinner_76.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_76.text: Everything is for sale. And you'd do well to sell while your stock has value - in desperate times, the price of honour plummets.

Dinner_56.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_56.text: Perhaps you haven't yet realised how desperate these times are. You will.

Dinner_48.speaker: Player
Dinner_48.text: Level your weapon at the creature.

Dinner_84.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_84.text: My, aren't you a nervous one! I assure you I'm here to help, not harm.

Dinner_92.speaker: Player
Dinner_92.text: What makes you think I need saving?

Dinner_87.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_87.text: Come now. Why play hard to get when you're in deep over your tadpoled head?

Dinner_91.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_91.text: Because my compassion is boundless. I stride among the needy, giving comfort where I can.

Dinner_6.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_6.text: And you're in dire need. One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.

Dinner_4.speaker: Player
Dinner_4.text: I don't care what you are - I care what you want.

Dinner_64.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_64.text: Oh, a mere trifle. How dear is one's soul, really?

Dinner_61.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_61.text: A rhetorical question, of course, but let me venture an answer.

Dinner_69.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_69.text: It's worth very little with a tadpole in your head.

Dinner_18.speaker: Player
Dinner_18.text: Can you be more specific than 'somewhere'?

Dinner_46.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_46.text: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?

Dinner_5.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_5.text: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
Dinner_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.

Dinner_2.speaker: Raphael
Dinner_2.text: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.

AD_Vanish_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish_0.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.
